goods.name: Pepper
goods.description: Black gold of the East. The most traded spice, valued across Europe for preserving meat and adding flavor. Portuguese traders pay premium prices.
goods.historicalNote: Pepper was so valuable it was sometimes used as currency. The phrase 'peppercorn rent' comes from this era.

goods.name: Cinnamon
goods.description: Aromatic bark from Ceylon. The Portuguese maintain a strict monopoly on this precious spice.
goods.historicalNote: Portuguese control of Ceylon's cinnamon trade was absolute. They executed anyone caught selling to other Europeans.

goods.name: Cloves
goods.description: Precious aromatic flower buds from the distant Spice Islands. Worth more than gold by weight.
goods.historicalNote: Cloves only grew naturally on a few small islands in the Moluccas, making them extraordinarily rare and valuable.

goods.name: Silk
goods.description: Luxurious fabric from the Middle Kingdom, brought to Goa via the Portuguese trading post in Macau.
goods.historicalNote: The Macau-Goa-Lisbon trade route was one of the most profitable in the world, with silk being a primary cargo.

goods.name: Porcelain
goods.description: Fine blue and white ceramics. Fragile but highly valued by European nobility.
goods.historicalNote: Chinese porcelain was so prized that European potters spent centuries trying to replicate its quality.

goods.name: Nutmeg
goods.description: A rare spice from the tiny Banda Islands. Both the seed and its covering (mace) are valuable.
goods.historicalNote: Nutmeg was believed to ward off plague. During outbreaks, its price could increase tenfold.

goods.name: Ginger
goods.description: Fresh or dried ginger root. Used in cooking and medicine throughout Europe.
goods.historicalNote: Ginger was one of the most commonly traded spices, more affordable than pepper.

goods.name: Indigo
goods.description: Deep blue dye extracted from plants. Essential for the European textile industry.
goods.historicalNote: Indian indigo was superior to European woad and became a major trade commodity.

spice.name: Spices
spice.description: Aromatic substances used for flavoring, preserving, and medicine.

fabric.name: Fabrics
fabric.description: Textiles and cloth from across Asia.

commodity.name: Commodities
commodity.description: Bulk goods used in manufacturing and trade.
